title: Christy's Awesome Hot Ham and Cheese Recipe
description: This ham and cheese sandwich is quickly made with Swiss cheese and deli ham grilled on whole grain bread for an easy, hot sandwich perfect for lunch.

great on a cool night with a cup of tomato soup. I add spinach, arugula, tomatoes, roasted peppers, chopped olives, artichokes, or a spoonful of salsa to the sandwich, depending on my mood and what's in the fridge. Original recipe (1X) yields 1 servings 2 slices whole grain bread 2 teaspoons butter 2 slices Swiss cheese 2 thin slices deli ham 1 teaspoon mayonnaise 1 teaspoon whole grain mustard Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Preheat a skillet over medium-high heat. Spread one side of each slice of bread with 1 teaspoon butter. Place one slice butter-side down in the hot skillet. Top with Swiss cheese and ham. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Spread the unbuttered side of second slice of bread with mayonnaise and mustard; place it butter-side up on sandwich. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cook in the hot skillet until golden brown and cheese is melted, about 3 minutes per side. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 162 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Christy's Awesome Hot Ham and Cheese 01 of 17 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 17 Photo by  SteadySalad2709 12/06/2022 Burned mine😜 03 of 17 Photo by  Kristina Miller 01/26/2020 04 of 17 Photo by  Brandon A 05/02/2016 I made this recipe. Instead of putting butter on the outside, I put mayonnaise on the outside, with just ham and cheese inside (grilled mayo side down). They turned out great and everyone enjoyed them! 05 of 17 Photo by  MrJoshHampton 02/01/2015 06 of 17 Photo by  Ieshia 02/23/2014 Absolutely awesome. My 1 & 2 year old LOVED it!!! 07 of 17 Photo by  kristyw 02/11/2014 I made this for my husband and he absolutely loved it! 08 of 17 Photo by  smartt 05/08/2013 09 of 17 Photo by  DIZ♥ 04/15/2013 Who would think you would need a recipe for a grilled ham n’ cheese? Well, this recipe is perfect! The ratios are perfect and each ingredient compliments the other. I’ve concluded it’s the whole grain bread that makes this sandwich what it is. I used a 9-grain bread with seeds and it just doesn’t get any better than this. 10 of 17 Photo by  TxCin2 07/25/2012 Fast tasty little sandwich. The cheese was a bit too much though so next time only 1 slice. I used Spicy brown coarse ground mustard, light mayo, and mesquite smoked shaved ham.
